verses.sanskrit:
श्रीप्रह्लाद उवाच ।
नृसिंहं कवचं वक्ष्ये प्रह्लादेनोदितं पुरा।
सर्वरक्षाकरं पुण्यं सर्वसम्पत्प्रदायकम्॥
verses.transliteration:
śrīprahlāda uvāca।
nṛsiṃhaṃ kavacaṃ vakṣye prahlādenoditaṃ purā।
sarvarakṣākaraṃ puṇyaṃ sarvasampatpradāyakam॥
verses.meaning: Sri Prahlada said: I shall speak the Narasimha Kavach, which was revealed by Prahlada in ancient times. It is sacred, protects from all dangers, and bestows all prosperity.

verses.sanskrit:
ॐ नृसिंहः पातु मे शिरः सर्वगो नेत्रयोरथ।
स्मृतो नासां सदा पातु मुखं लक्ष्मीमुखप्रियः॥
सर्वविद्याधिपः पातु सर्वतोमुखमस्तकम्।
जिह्वां विद्याधिपो मे त्वं कण्ठं पातु जनार्दनः॥
verses.transliteration:
oṃ nṛsiṃhaḥ pātu me śiraḥ sarvago netrayoratha।
smṛto nāsāṃ sadā pātu mukhaṃ lakṣmīmukhapriyaḥ॥
sarvavidyādhipaḥ pātu sarvatomukhamastakam।
jihvāṃ vidyādhipo me tvaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ pātu janārdanaḥ॥
verses.meaning: May Narasimha protect my head, may the all-pervading Lord protect my eyes. May He who is always remembered protect my nose, and the beloved of Lakshmi protect my face. May the Lord of all knowledge protect my entire head. You, the Lord of learning, protect my tongue, and may Janardana protect my throat.

verses.sanskrit:
स्कन्धौ भूभारहा धत्ते भुजौ मे धरणीधरः।
कराभ्यां नरशार्दूलो नरदो हृदयं मम॥
मध्यं पातु हिरण्याक्षवक्षःकुक्षिविदारणः।
नाभिं मे पातु नाभेशो ब्रह्माण्डघटनक्षमः॥
verses.transliteration:
skandhau bhūbhārahā dhatte bhujau me dharaṇīdharaḥ।
karābhyāṃ naraśārdūlo narado hṛdayaṃ mama॥
madhyaṃ pātu hiraṇyākṣavakṣaḥkukṣividāraṇaḥ।
nābhiṃ me pātu nābheśo brahmāṇḍaghaṭanakṣamaḥ॥
verses.meaning: May the bearer of the earth's burden support my shoulders, and the supporter of the earth protect my arms. May Nara-shardula (man-lion) protect my hands, and Narada protect my heart. May He who tore the chest and belly of Hiranyaksha protect my middle. May the Lord of the navel, capable of creating universes, protect my navel.

verses.sanskrit:
कट्यां मे केशवो रक्षेत्सक्थिनी रक्षतु च्यतः।
ऊरू मनोरथप्रदः पातु जानुनी नारायणः॥
जङ्घे विष्वक्सेनो मे पादौ श्रीपतिरव्ययः।
सर्वाङ्गं सर्वगोऽप्यस्य नृहरिस्तु रविलोचनः॥
verses.transliteration:
kaṭyāṃ me keśavo rakṣetsakthinī rakṣatu cyataḥ।
ūrū manorathapradadaḥ pātu jānunī nārāyaṇaḥ॥
jaṅghe viṣvakseno me pādau śrīpatiravyayaḥ।
sarvāṅgaṃ sarvago'pyasya nṛharistu ravilocanaḥ॥
verses.meaning: May Keshava protect my waist and the infallible Lord protect my thighs. May the fulfiller of desires protect my thighs and Narayana protect my knees. May Vishvaksena protect my shanks, and the imperishable Lord of Lakshmi protect my feet. May the all-pervading Nrihari with sun-like eyes protect all my limbs.

verses.sanskrit:
रक्षत्वज्ञातसम्भूतीरप्रमेयपराक्रमः।
यं यं नुस्मरते भीतः शत्रुव्याधिभयादिषु॥
श्रीनृसिंहः स तं सर्वतो रक्षतु सर्वदा।
इति ते कथितं देवि परमं रक्षणं महत्॥
verses.transliteration:
rakṣatvaajñātasambhūtīraprameyaparākramaḥ।
yaṃ yaṃ nusmaret bhītaḥ śatruvyādhibhayādiṣu॥
śrīnṛsiṃhaḥ sa taṃ sarvato rakṣatu sarvadā।
iti te kathitaṃ devi paramaṃ rakṣaṇaṃ mahat॥
verses.meaning: May He of immeasurable power protect from unknown dangers. Whoever remembers Him in fear - from enemies, diseases, and other terrors - that person is always protected by Sri Narasimha from all sides. Thus, O Goddess, I have told you this supreme and great protection.

verses.sanskrit:
इदं नृसिंहकवचं त्रैलोक्यविजयावहम्।
यः प्रत्युत्थाय प्रातःकाले सन्ध्याकाले समाहितः।
स शत्रुगणमर्दी स्यात् तस्य वश्याः सुरासुराः॥
verses.transliteration:
idaṃ nṛsiṃhakavacaṃ trailokyavijayāvaham।
yaḥ pratyutthāya prātaḥkāle sandhyākāle samāhitaḥ।
sa śatrugaṇamardī syāt tasya vaśyāḥ surāsurāḥ॥
verses.meaning: This Narasimha Kavach brings victory over the three worlds. One who rises early and recites this with concentration at dawn and dusk becomes the crusher of enemy hosts. Gods and demons come under his control.

verses.sanskrit:
भूतप्रेतपिशाचाश्च राक्षसाः यक्षकिन्नराः।
ब्रह्मराक्षसवेताला डाकिन्यः शाकिनी तथा॥
न तस्य कुर्वन्ति बाधां कवचेनावृतो हि यः॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūtapretapiśācāśca rākṣasāḥ yakṣakinnarāḥ।
brahmarākṣasavetālā ḍākinyaḥ śākinī tathā॥
na tasya kurvanti bādhāṃ kavacenāvṛto hi yaḥ॥
verses.meaning: Bhutas, pretas, pisachas, rakshasas, yakshas, kinnaras, brahmarakshasa, vetalas, dakinis and shakinis - none of these can harm one who is protected by this Kavach.

verses.sanskrit:
गुह्यादगुह्यतमं यत्तदुच्यते बुधैर्मम।
न देयं यस्य कस्यापि गोपनीयं प्रयत्नतः॥
मारणोच्चाटनाद्येषु कृत्येषु च महाफलम्।
संग्रामे च विजेतव्यमेककालं मृतं भवेत्॥
verses.transliteration:
guhyādaguhyatamaṃ yattaducyate budhairm ama।
na deyaṃ yasya kasyāpi gopanīyaṃ prayatnataḥ॥
māraṇoccāṭanādyeṣu kṛtyeṣu ca mahāphalam।
saṃgrāme ca vijetavyamekakālaṃ mṛtaṃ bhavet॥
verses.meaning: This is called the most secret of all secrets by the wise. It should not be given to just anyone and should be carefully kept secret. In acts like destroying enemies or removing obstacles, it brings great results. In battle, one becomes victorious, and death flees at once.

verses.sanskrit:
त्रिकालं यः पठेन्नित्यं सर्वान्कामानवाप्नुयात्।
पुत्रं विद्यां धनं धान्यं सर्वदुःखक्षयं व्रजेत्॥
यः पठेत् सर्वदा भक्त्या स हि विष्णुः सदा प्रभुः॥
verses.transliteration:
trikālaṃ yaḥ paṭhennityaṃ sarvānkāmānavāpnuyāt।
putraṃ vidyāṃ dhanaṃ dhānyaṃ sarvaduḥkhakṣayaṃ vrajet॥
yaḥ paṭhet sarvadā bhaktyā sa hi viṣṇuḥ sadā prabhuḥ॥
verses.meaning: One who recites this three times daily obtains all desires - sons, knowledge, wealth, grains, and destruction of all sorrows. One who recites this always with devotion becomes like Lord Vishnu himself, always the master.

verses.sanskrit:
इति श्रीब्रह्माण्डपुराणे प्रह्लादोक्तं नृसिंहकवचम् सम्पूर्णम्॥
॥ ॐ तत्सत् ॥
verses.transliteration:
iti śrībrahmāṇḍapurāṇe prahlādoktaṃ nṛsiṃhakavacam sampūrṇam॥
॥ oṃ tatsat ॥
verses.meaning: Thus ends the Narasimha Kavach spoken by Prahlada from the Brahmanda Purana. Om Tat Sat.
